intro: Galium buschiorum, commonly known as the Buschiorum bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to certain regions of North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its slender stems are often prostrate or ascending, and it produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
